item.title: Illegal dumping in private bin, 12th June
item.description:
I am reporting an incident of illegal waste dumping involving my private bin. I live in 11, tanhurst walk, where our bins bins are stored in a communal area inside our park. Someone unknown took my general waste bin from the communal bin area and filled it with large amounts of loose waste, including inappropriate materials (not in black bin bags, as required for collection). They then moved the bin and dumped it in our communal park/parking area. As a result, the bin could not be emptied. I had temporarily moved the bin to the parking to avoid causing a mess near the other bins. However, the next day I found that someone had tipped the bin over completely and spread all the waste on the grass. This was not my waste and I did not cause this dumping. My bin was used without my consent. I have attached photos clearly showing: My bin tipped over in the communal park/parking area The scattered waste The bin improperly filled with loose rubbish The communal area is next to a small parking lot (as shown in the photos). This was deliberate illegal dumping by someone else. I request that the council treats this as fly-tipping and investigates (there may be CCTV or neighbours who saw the person responsible). Please arrange to remove the dumped waste and advise how I can protect my bin from further misuse. Thank you for your help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lanridge Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked bin chute, 12th June
item.description:
The bin chute has been blocked and filled with rubbish. The chute has been blocked from a lower level. The buildup of rubbish has now caused a foul smell in the communal area of the building which also could be smelt from inside our houses.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree pruned outside house in Danson crescent., 12th June
item.description:
We parked our car outside a house in Danson Crescent near the park this morning next to a tree, to take our dog for a walk . On our return we found our car covered in bits of tree, twigs leaves and sawdust (all along the windscreen grille, the car windows and bodywork). As we got in the car the seats also got covered in sawdust. When we parked there were no warning signs telling us of the work due to be done. Had this been the case we would not have parked there. The mess this pruning created on our car has resulted in us having to spend time to remove all the debris both outside and inside to clean our car to return it to it's original condition.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Crescent, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verges recently cut and trimmed grass cutting blown onto private driveways and into road, 12th June
item.description:
Our idilic tree lined avenue in what is reported to be a respectable London suburb is becoming unloved and uncared for. Please include street cleaning in the process which involves making a mess. If I deposit debris in the street it would be deemed a criminal offence and I would be punished. Please explain why the contractor is allowed to get away with this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Avenue, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
